derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (originally denoting a utensil for pouring liquids): from Middle Dutch, Middle Low German schōpe 'waterwheel bucket'; from a West Germanic base meaning 'draw water'; related to the verb shape

entry.tran: (敏捷地)抱起，拿起，捡起,拽过来
entry.def: If you scoop a person or thing somewhere, you put your hands or arms under or round them and quickly move them there.

example.ex: Michael knelt next to her and scooped her into his arms.
example.tran: 迈克尔挨着她跪下，一下把她揽入怀里。

entry.def: If you scoop something from a container, you remove it with something such as a spoon.

example.ex: ...the sound of a spoon scooping dog food out of a can.
example.tran: 用勺子从罐子里舀狗粮的声音

entry.def: A scoop is an object like a spoon which is used for picking up a quantity of a food such as ice cream or an ingredient such as flour.

example.tran: 一个吃冰激凌的小勺儿

entry.tran: 抢先报道的新闻;独家新闻
entry.def: You can use scoop to refer to an exciting news story which is reported in one newspaper or on one television programme before it appears anywhere else.

example.ex: ...one of the biggest scoops in the history of newspapers.
example.tran: 报业史上最大的独家新闻之一

entry.def: If a newspaper scoops other newspapers, it succeeds in printing an exciting or important story before they do.

example.ex: All the newspapers really want to do is scoop the opposition.
example.tran: 所有报社真正想做的就是比对手抢先报道。

entry.tran: 获取，赢得，捧走(奖金或奖项)
entry.def: If you scoop a prize or award, you win it.

example.ex: ...films which scooped awards around the world.
example.tran: 在全世界赢得各种奖项的影片

entry.def: If something such as a dress has a scoop neck or a scooped neck, the neck has the shape of a wide, deep curve at the front.

means.word_mean: 1. the quantity a scoop will hold
2. a hollow concave shape made by removing something
3. a news report that is reported first by one news organization;

sentences.sentence: "he got a scoop on the bribery of city officials"

means.word_mean: 5. the shovel or bucket of dredge or backhoe

sentences.sentence: "he used a scoop to serve the ice cream"

means.word_mean: 1. take out or up with or as if with a scoop;

sentences.sentence: "scoop the sugar out of the container"
"the goal was to best the competition"

sentences.en: She made a scoop with her hand and picked up what she had dropped.
sentences.cn: 她把手做成勺状抄起她掉下的东西。

sentences.en: Just one scoop of mashed potato for me, please.
Getting that story was the scoop of a lifetime for the journalist.
sentences.cn: 获得那个消息是这位记者终身难逢的独家新闻。

sentences.en: He scooped some ice-cream out of the tub.
sentences.cn: 他从桶里舀了一些冰淇淋。

sentences.en: They scooped the other newspapers by revealing the matter.
sentences.cn: 他们抢先报道了这件事。
